abstract: Boeing adjusts its responsiveness after a flap over 8-year-old Harry Winsor’s letter to the airplane company.
snippet: Boeing adjusts its responsiveness after a flap over 8-year-old Harry Winsor’s letter to the airplane company.
lead_paragraph: Harry Winsor, an 8-year-old from Boulder, Colo., loves airplanes. He flies with his father, John Winsor, the chief executive of the ad agency Victors & Spoils, to places like Europe and Africa regularly. Recently, he began designing his own airplanes, and decided to send one such drawing to Boeing with the suggestion that they manufacture his plane.
